sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A man who suffered a cardiac arrest was helped to survive after a defibrillator was delivered by a drone just four minutes after the emergency call was received.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It meant the defibrillation could begin before the ambulance turned up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 71-year-old Sven was in his garden in Sweden when he had the heart attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It was in the morning and it had snowed about five centimetres so I went out to shovel the driveway. When I had done about half I fell to the ground and I don't remember anything else.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: My wife was looking out the window, saw that I was lying down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She used to be a nurse, so she ran out and started CPR.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And then we looked up and saw that it was a drone that dropped a defibrillator this is the first time the ever drone device has helped save a life and it's practically autonomous so as soon as the dispatch center suspects a cardiac arrest situation the drone system is booting up the doors of the hangar is opening, the pilot in command who monitors the operation, he obtains clearance from the flight tower for takeoff and then he just monitors the operation which is 99% autonomous. The Everdrone company is now in talks to deliver the device to other other countries, including the UK.
